class.name: OrderModifier
class.description: which returns an array of IDs SEQUENCE - USE FOR ALL MODIFIERS!!! *** 1. model defining static variables (e.g. $db, $has_one) *** 2. cms variables + functions (e.g. getCMSFields, $searchableFields) *** 3. other (non) static variables (e.g. private static $special_name_for_something, protected $order) *** 4. CRUD functions (e.g. canEdit) *** 5. init and update functions *** 6. form functions (e. g. Showform and getform) *** 7. template functions (e.g. ShowInTable, TableTitle, etc...) ... USES DB VALUES *** 8. inner calculations.... USES CALCULATED VALUES *** 9. calculate database fields: protected function Live[field name] ... USES CALCULATED VALUES *** 10. standard database related functions (e.g. onBeforeWrite, onAfterWrite, etc...) *** 11. AJAX related functions *** 12. debug functions

class.description: Deals with special form handling in CMS, mainly around {@link PjaxResponseNegotiator}

class.name: LeftAndMainExtension
class.description: Plug-ins for additional functionality in your LeftAndMain classes.

class.name: GroupImportForm
class.description: Imports {@link Group} records by CSV upload, as defined in {@link GroupCsvBulkLoader}.

class.name: CMSMenuItem
class.description: A simple CMS menu item.

interface.name: CMSPreviewable
interface.description: Interface to provide enough information about a record to make it previewable through the CMS. It uses the record database ID, its "frontend" and "backend" links to link up the edit form with its preview.

class.name: CMSMenu
class.description: The object manages the main CMS menu. See {@link LeftAndMain::init()} for example usage.

class.name: SecurityAdmin
class.description: Security section of the CMS

class.name: ViewableData
class.description: A ViewableData object is any object that can be rendered into a template/view.

class.name: ViewableData_Debugger
class.description: Allows you to render debug information about a {@link ViewableData} object into a template.

interface.name: TemplateIteratorProvider
interface.description: Interface that is implemented by any classes that want to expose a method that can be called in any scope in a template that returns values dependant on the state of the iterator of the current scope.

interface.name: TemplateParser
interface.description: This interface needs to be implemented by any template parser that is used in SSViewer

interface.name: TemplateGlobalProvider
interface.description: Interface that is implemented by any classes that want to expose a method that can be called in any scope in a template.

class.name: Requirements
class.description: Requirements tracker, for javascript and css.

class.name: SSViewer_Scope
class.description: This tracks the current scope for an SSViewer instance. It has three goals: - Handle entering & leaving sub-scopes in loops and withs - Track Up and Top - (As a side effect) Inject data that needs to be available globally (used to live in ViewableData)

class.name: SSViewer_BasicIteratorSupport
class.description: Defines an extra set of basic methods that can be used in templates that are not defined on sub-classes of {@link ViewableData}.

class.name: SSViewer_DataPresenter
class.description: This extends SSViewer_Scope to mix in data on top of what the item provides. This can be "global" data that is scope-independant (like BaseURL), or type-specific data that is layered on top cross-cut like (like $FirstLast etc).

class.name: SSViewer
class.description: Parses a template file with an *.ss file extension.

class.name: SSViewer_FromString
class.description: Special SSViewer that will process a template passed as a string, rather than a filename.

class.name: ArrayData
class.description: Lets you wrap a bunch of array data, or object members, into a {@link ViewableData} object.

class.name: SSTemplateParseException
class.description: This is the exception raised when failing to parse a template. Note that we don't currently do any static analysis, so we can't know if the template will run, just if it's malformed. It also won't catch mistakes that still look valid.

class.name: SSTemplateParser
class.description: This is the parser for the SilverStripe template language. It gets called on a string and uses a php-peg parser to match that string against the language structure, building up the PHP code to execute that structure as it parses

class.name: CliController
class.description: Base class invoked from CLI rather than the webserver (Cron jobs, handling email bounces).

class.name: Group
class.description: A security group.

class.name: Member
class.description: The member class which represents the users of the system

class.name: Member_GroupSet
class.description: Represents a set of Groups attached to a member.

class.name: Member_ChangePasswordEmail
class.description: Class used as template to send an email saying that the password has been changed.

class.name: Member_ForgotPasswordEmail
class.description: Class used as template to send the forgot password email

class.name: Member_Validator
class.description: Member Validator

class.name: MemberPassword
class.description: Keep track of users' previous passwords, so that we can check that new passwords aren't changed back to old ones.

class.name: PermissionCheckboxSetField
class.description: Shows a categorized list of available permissions (through {@link Permission::get_codes()}).

class.name: PermissionCheckboxSetField_Readonly
class.description: Readonly version of a {@link PermissionCheckboxSetField} - uses the same structure, but has all checkboxes disabled.

class.name: Authenticator
class.description: Abstract base class for an authentication method

interface.name: PermissionProvider
interface.description: Used to let classes provide new permission codes.

class.name: CMSSecurity
class.description: Provides a security interface functionality within the cms

class.name: PasswordValidator
class.description: This class represents a validator for member passwords.

class.name: RandomGenerator
class.description: Generates entropy values based on strongest available methods (mcrypt_create_iv(), openssl_random_pseudo_bytes(), /dev/urandom, COM.CAPICOM.Utilities.1, mt_rand()).

class.name: LoginForm
class.description: Abstract base class for a login form

class.name: MemberCsvBulkLoader
class.description: Imports member records, and checks/updates duplicates based on their 'Email' property.

class.name: CMSMemberLoginForm
class.description: Provides the in-cms session re-authentication form for the "member" authenticator

class.name: ChangePasswordForm
class.description: Standard Change Password Form

class.name: MemberAuthenticator
class.description: Authenticator for the default "member" method

class.name: Security
class.description: Implements a basic security model

class.name: LoginAttempt
class.description: Record all login attempts through the {@link LoginForm} object.

class.name: MemberLoginForm
class.description: Log-in form for the "member" authentication method.

class.name: PermissionFailureException
class.description: Throw this exception to register that a user doesn't have permission to do the given action and potentially redirect them to the log-in page. The exception message may be presented to the user, so it shouldn't be in nerd-speak.

class.name: BasicAuth
class.description: Provides an interface to HTTP basic authentication.

class.name: Permission
class.description: Represents a permission assigned to a group.

class.name: Permission_Group
class.description: Permission_Group class

class.name: PermissionRoleCode
class.description: A PermissionRoleCode represents a single permission code assigned to a {@link PermissionRole}.

class.name: PasswordEncryptor
class.description: Allows pluggable password encryption.

class.name: PasswordEncryptor_Blowfish
class.description: Blowfish encryption - this is the default from SilverStripe 3.

class.name: PasswordEncryptor_PHPHash
class.description: Encryption using built-in hash types in PHP.

class.name: PasswordEncryptor_LegacyPHPHash
class.description: Legacy implementation for SilverStripe 2.1 - 2.3, which had a design flaw in password hashing that caused the hashes to differ between architectures due to floating point precision problems in base_convert().

class.name: PasswordEncryptor_MySQLPassword
class.description: Uses MySQL's PASSWORD encryption. Requires an active DB connection.

class.name: PasswordEncryptor_MySQLOldPassword
class.description: Uses MySQL's OLD_PASSWORD encyrption. Requires an active DB connection.

class.name: PasswordEncryptor_None
class.description: Cleartext passwords (used in SilverStripe 2.1).

class.name: PermissionRole
class.description: A PermissionRole represents a collection of permission codes that can be applied to groups.

class.name: SecurityToken
class.description: Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection for the {@link Form} class and other GET links.

class.name: NullSecurityToken
class.description: Specialized subclass for disabled security tokens - always returns TRUE for token checks. Use through {@link SecurityToken::disable()}.

class.name: Email
class.description: Class to support sending emails.

class.name: Mailer
class.description: Mailer objects are responsible for actually sending emails.

class.name: StartsWithFilter
class.description: Matches textual content with a substring match from the beginning of the string.

class.name: StartsWithMultiFilter
class.description: Checks if a value starts with one of the items of in a given set.

class.name: FulltextFilter
class.description: Filters by full-text matching on the given field.

class.name: NegationFilter
class.description: Matches on rows where the field is not equal to the given value.

class.name: GreaterThanFilter
class.description: Selects numerical/date content greater than the input

class.name: SearchFilter
class.description: Base class for filtering implementations, which work together with {@link SearchContext} to create or amend a query for {@link DataObject} instances.

class.name: GreaterThanOrEqualFilter
class.description: Selects numerical/date content greater than or equal to the input

class.name: EndsWithFilter
class.description: Matches textual content with a substring match on a text fragment leading to the end of the string.

class.name: PartialMatchFilter
class.description: Matches textual content with a LIKE '%keyword%' construct.

class.name: ComparisonFilter
class.description: Base class for creating comparison filters, eg; greater than, less than, greater than or equal, etc

class.name: LessThanFilter
class.description: Selects numerical/date content less than the input

class.name: LessThanOrEqualFilter
class.description: Selects numerical/date content less than or equal to the input

class.name: ExactMatchFilter
class.description: Selects textual content with an exact match between columnname and keyword.

class.name: ExactMatchMultiFilter
class.description: Checks if a value is in a given set.

class.name: FulltextSearchable
class.description: Provides a simple search engine for your site based on the MySQL FULLTEXT index.

class.name: SearchContext
class.description: Manages searching of properties on one or more {@link DataObject} types, based on a given set of input parameters.

class.name: Folder
class.description: Represents a folder in the assets/ directory.

class.name: SS_FileFinder
class.description: A utility class that finds any files matching a set of rules that are present within a directory tree.

class.name: Filesystem
class.description: A collection of static methods for manipulating the filesystem.

class.name: GDBackend
class.description: A wrapper class for GD-based images, with lots of manipulation functions.

class.name: GD
class.description: This class is maintained for backwards-compatibility only. Please use the {@link GDBackend} class instead.

class.name: FileNameFilter
class.description: Filter certain characters from file name, for nicer (more SEO-friendly) URLs as well as better filesystem compatibility. Can be used for files and folders.

class.name: File
class.description: This class handles the representation of a file on the filesystem within the framework.

class.name: Upload
class.description: Manages uploads via HTML forms processed by PHP, uploads to Silverstripe's default upload directory, and either creates a new or uses an existing File-object for syncing with the database.

class.name: SS_HTMLValue
class.description: This class handles the converting of HTML fragments between a string and a DOMDocument based representation.

class.name: Versioned

class.name: Versioned_Version
class.description: Represents a single version of a record.

class.name: SS_Query

class.name: DataList
class.description: Implements a "lazy loading" DataObjectSet.

class.name: Hierarchy
class.description: DataObjects that use the Hierarchy extension can be be organised as a hierarchy, with children and parents.

class.name: MySQLDatabase

class.name: MySQLQuery

class.name: Image

class.name: RSSFeed

class.name: RSSFeed_Entry
class.description: RSSFeed_Entry class

class.name: HtmlEditorSanitiser

class.description: Transformation that disables all the fields on the form.

class.description: Similar to {@link GridFieldConfig_RecordEditor}, but adds features to work on has-many or many-many relationships.

interface.name: GridFieldComponent

interface.name: GridField_HTMLProvider
interface.description: A GridField manipulator that provides HTML for the header/footer rows, or f or before/after the template.

interface.name: GridField_ColumnProvider
interface.description: Add a new column to the table display body, or modify existing columns.

interface.name: GridField_ActionProvider
interface.description: An action is defined by two things: an action name, and zero or more named arguments.

interface.name: GridField_DataManipulator

interface.description: Sometimes an action isn't enough: you need to provide additional support URLs for the {@link GridField}.

interface.name: GridField_SaveHandler
interface.description: A component which is used to handle when a {@link GridField} is saved into a record.

class.name: GridFieldExportButton

class.name: TabSet

class.name: SelectionGroup

Using CSS, you can configure the field to only display its contents if the corresponding radio button is selected. Each item is defined through {@link SelectionGroup_Item}.

class.name: LiteralField

class.name: HtmlEditorField_Image
class.description: Encapsulation of an image tag, linking to an image either internal or external to the site.

class.name: ListboxField

class.name: Token
class.description: A Token is any portion of a match rule. Tokens are responsible for generating the code to match against them.

class.name: Pending
class.description: Handles storing of information for an expression that applys to the next token, and deletion of that information after applying

class.name: Rule
class.description: Rule parsing and code generation

class.name: ParserRegexp
class.description: We cache the last regex result. This is a low-cost optimization, because we have to do an un-anchored match + check match position anyway (alternative is to do an anchored match on a string cut with substr, but that is very slow for long strings). We then don't need to recheck for any position between current position and eventual match position - result will be the same

class.name: Parser
class.description: Parser base class - handles current position in string - handles matching that position against literal or rx - some abstraction of code that would otherwise be repeated many times in a compiled grammer, mostly related to calling user functions for result construction and building

class.name: Packrat
class.description: By inheriting from Packrat instead of Parser, the parser will run in linear time (instead of exponential like Parser), but will require a lot more memory, since every match-attempt at every position is memorised.

class.name: FalseOnlyPackrat
class.description: FalseOnlyPackrat only remembers which results where false. Experimental.

class.name: ConservativePackrat
class.description: Conservative Packrat will only memo-ize a result on the second hit, making it more memory-lean than Packrat, but less likely to go exponential that Parser. Because the store logic is much more complicated this is a net loss over Parser for many simple grammars.
